text:
Aromă slabă, cu multe fructe ușor fermentate și flori, dulceață de caise cu miere, nuanțe grele de hamei pământos.
Gust ușor dulce, puțin amar, cu malț caramelizat, fructe fermentate, ceva fructe alterate, hamei pământos.
Bună.
Frisch gezapft. Klar und bernsteinfarben mit mittelgroßer Schaumkrone. Muffig. Leicht muffig. Leichter Körper. Wässrig.
Tried this one part of LCBO spring program. Bitter and dry, lack a bit of depth. Tried it, done.
Cask at the brewery. Brown with a good foamy cream head. Malty toast aroma. The taste is toast with a bitter metallic finish. Nice.

Bottle. Clear amber-dark copper body, medium dense beige head with great retention and lots of lacing. Yeasty fresh aroma: lots of yeast, dough, green apples, herbs, caramel and bread. Taste of bitter herbs, bread, molasses and biscuits. Chewy, refreshing and refined.

bottle, dark amberm small off white head.
odour: caramel, molasses, grapejuice, honey.
light sweetness, medium bitterness in the beginning. very dry finish, moderate to heavy bitterness in finish, soft carbonisation, medium to light body.

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark amber to copper with a small slightly beige head. The aroma is medium malty (bread, some caramel) with a light fruitiness (plums and grapes). Light to medium watery body with a low carbonation a light sweetness and a medium bitterness (heavy in the finish). The taste starts malty - sweet grains, bread, caramel, honey, some roasted notes, some dark fruits, some cardboard and a lingering hoppy bitterness in the finish.
Altbeer is not really my thing (miss the carbonation and the mouthfeel) but the taste is indeed full-bodied and complex.
Several 0,2 l draght @ Zum Uerige, Düsseldorf (April 21, 2017). Appearance is brown and clear. Taste is hoppy and floral, just a little bit watery, but still complicated to keep it interesting.

2017/05/02 - Pours a clear, brown-orange colour with a frothy, off white head that slowly reduces and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is caramel, bready, yeast, banana, dark fruits with a subtle hint of smoke and grassy hops. Taste is light toffee, bready notes and grassy hops. Mouthfeel is medium to full with lightly biting carbonation and a drying, roasted finish. Lots of character and well put together. Nicely done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice appearance, reddish bronze with a tan creamy and fluffy head. Smell like caramel and bread. Taste is lots of big malts, good balance of dry and sweet, creamy and medium bodied, very gentle palate with the low alcohol content, a very refined beer with depth.

Bottle from the LCBO. Hazy dark copper with a one finger thick lingering head. Nose is roasted malt, caramel, bread, some light dark fruit and a touch of nuttiness, and strong grassy hops. Light sweet molasses under a medium grassy bitterness and a light tartness. Mouth is medium and slick with average carbonation and a dry finish. 

7/4-/6+/4-/15
Easy drinking yet with a bitter hoppy bite at the finish. Subtle caramel malts and near-coffee like roasted malts, some herbal/woody aspects too. Understated perfection and balance.

Couleur cuivre vieilli, arborant peu de mousse, cette version Dusseldorf-oise de "vieille bière" est peu odorante (malts rôtis, bois, caramel et pêche), mais elle est plus fonceuse en bouche : une bonne amertume, qui vient couper des malts ronds et caramélisés (cassonnade). Peu de complexité, mais son mordant gustatif compense facilement. Version classique dun classique, superbe et envoûtant, presque sans faute pour le style.

Pours a dark and slightly hazy copper with a coarse lather of head. The aroma is a bit muted, as it is capped the by head, but when it comes through it is heavily malted biscuits and syrup. On the palate there is aggressive carbonation and a medium-heavy weight. Would have guessed the alcohol level above 6%, not 4.7%. Flavours are mostly malty bread, with mineral notes, backed up by ample bitterness and sourness, with a bit of sweetness. Pleasant and filling.
Bottle at home. Pours deep amber, nose is bready, toffee, grassy, taste is sweet toffee, dry, yeasty.

Best before date on back label is 12/2017. Pours a slight hazy amber colour with a huge creamy warm beige cap from the active carbonation. Very long lasting with thick foamy lacing. Sweet aromas of caramel, toasted malts, bread and hints of banana, bubble gum. The taste is not really sweet. A little fruitiness, but more breaded malts with the yeast. Some decent hoppiness in the finish. A good Altbier, but seems to be stronger on wheat with the banana notes.

It pours muddy blood coloured and clear; the head is off-white and foamy. The aroma has notes of: toffee, toast, honey, pine, orange-zest, and grass. The taste is medium bitter. The palate is medium-light bodied and has a slight astringency; the carbonation is light, and the finish is medium. Overall, a very tasty little number.

330ml bottle. Clear mahogany with a foamy beige head. Flavors are bread, toasted cereals, light roast and nuts with fruity and woodsy notes notes. Medium body, moderate to good carbonation, smooth texture.

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with a lasting, creamy beige head. Aroma of toasted malt, dark fruits, hazelnut. Taste is toasted malt, dark fruits, brown bread, nutty. A bit earthy. Some grassy notes. Finish is malty, earthy and is mildly to moderately bitter. Has a lot of flavor for 4.7% ABV. Solid.

500 ml flip-top bottle opened with a moderate pop, via trade with Koelschtrinker. Thank you!
Looks: Clear copper red colour; Explosive four finger head with lasting crumpety off-white foam; Excellent sticky lacing with fizzy small carbonation.

Aroma: Very Fragrant Amber malt which can be smelt as soon as it was popped, with strong plums, dark fruits, red fruits, fresh toasts, roasted chestnut shells, strong toffee, caramel, cocoa powder, Cola, sugar, dark bread and light grass. So fresh and charming!

Taste: Close to light sweet Amber malt, with caramel, light toffee, strong burnt toast, Cola, red fruits, floral, fair molasses, strong herbs, biscuits, strong lemon, very strong bitter hops and sharp grass. Wow!

Body: Mid to light body. Slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Solid Amber maltyness in a fairly thick background. Very strong bitterness - burnt toast and hops - hits hard which overwhelm red fruits and caramel. Flowery and moderate sweet, again overshadowed by strong herbal grassy hops. Dry biscuit with strong lemon to round. Strong and impressive!

Hoppiness: Light grass in nose. Floral, strong herbs, strong lemon and sharp grass in taste; Bitterness is immensely strong for a lasting, very high astringent herbal malty finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Burnt and very bitter to mouth.

Comments: My first taste of a real Alt from Düsseldorf, and I can feel the freshness right from the strong and colorful nutty fruity aroma. The wacky toasty and hop bitterness is unexpected. It is very strong , but its tastier and certainly more agreeable than Nine Dragons Fist of Fury. Very strong and refreshing. I love it!
Draught. Very alty but with a somewhat rough finish. The taste is slightly sweet.
Bottled. Dark brown-raisin body, thick beige head. The aroma is musty, with port wine notes. The taste is earthy, with flowers and malt, some licorice.

0.33l swing top bottle thanks to Cristobal37. Clear amber body with a thick beige head. Aroma of bread, caramel, roasted malts, cherries and dark fruits. Taste of bread, toast, dark fruits, roasted malts and floral hops. The finish has both roasty and hoppy bitterness that is even a bit harsh for me for the first sip, but I definitely like this beer.

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a clear caramel colour with good-sized cream-coloured head that leaves nice lacing. Aroma is crusty bread, earthy/herbal character and some fruitiness. Flavour has modestly toasty graininess, sharp fruitiness and lots of earthy and herbal character. Surprisingly bitter in the finish. Ineteresting.

330ml bottle. My FIRST real Alt from Germany. Pours a lovely hazy copper hue with a light beige cap. On the nose dried fruits, a light floral note, faint earthiness, and burnt sugar. Taste wise, medium bodied with apparent bitterness of the metallic sort out of the gate, followed by raisins, light dried cherry, brown sugar and dark rye bread that heads into more bitterness, and dark bread-like malts with more dried cherry, cocoa, and metallic bitterness in the finish. Solid.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2017 Pop top bottle. Dank basement and grains on the nose. Very bitter on the back of the tongue like earl grey tea. Light bodied easy drinking but this bitterness is extremely dry and leaves a strong comanding impression on the palate. And while the palate is not wimpy, it?s not very good either. Not what I expected, the taste is not pleasant at all. Curious what the Sticke and Doppelsticke will be like.

Bottle from LCBO. Well clearly the Alts Ive tried from Ontario brewers are a bust. This is clarifying & educational. Deep brown pour with a mushy foam cap. Thick grain, with a deep earthy middle & one of the longest & most intriguing bitter finishes Ive had in a long time. Its really clean & distinct & unique. You need to try this.
330ml bottle from the LCBO. classic alt, a little to bitter and rough but still stylistically spot on. moreish and sessionable

Bottle from lcbo, pours a big bubble head. Has real old school style with punchy yeast and a herbal almost medicinal dryness. Somewhere a pale cookie malt trying to poke through. Seems like a beer I would need many more of to understand?

330ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a clear deep amber colour with one finger of lasting head. Soapy lacing clinging to the side of the glass. On the nose I get some fruity aromas like citrus and grapes. Also bread and a whiff of caramel is present. Taste has a hoppy backbone with notes of plain crackers, grass, and black peppers which leads to a dry and spicy finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Its not my cup of tea...Too dry and spicy for a beer with low alcohol content.
Dark Amber colour. Sweet toffie aroma. Semi dry taste, caramel and toffie. Happy finish.
Draft. Dark amber beer. Roasty fruity (citrus) malts (toffee, caramel, burnt sugar) balanced by crisp floral and grassy hops. Good malt/hop balance. Nice bitterness. Dry bitter hoppy finish. (2008)

bottled Version
L:
-pours a clear copper with a small to medium,foamy,offwhite head
-medium to high carbonation visible
S:
-grassy,roasty,caramel,spicy,plums,st bitterniss for the style
F:
-medium carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Just an amazing Altbier.All others are judged by its standard.

On Tap:
On tap, the fruity Ale Yeast esters are more dominant.Other than that its the same.

Bottle at home. From Wine Rack, West Byfleet. Sweet caramel and grass aroma. Dark Amber. Fluffy off-white head. Light sweetness through to a tangy bitterness that continues in to the long finish. Malt and citrus with a honey undercurrent. Light bodied. Impactful carbonation with a softness to the body. A dry element combines with the carbonation on the tongue. Decent if overly carbonated.
Very fresh bottle from Erzengel (euro local swap 4/2016), many thanks! Pours amber with an off white head. Earthy, herbal, caramel, light sour notes, medium bitter and fairly bitter finish. Nice.
Bottle. Amber colour with stable head off. Aroma of yeasts, hops. Taste is medium sourness, very bitter, caramel, straw, bread, some berries. Dry bitter finish

Aroma: melanoidins, candies, flowers, herbs.
Appearance: clear amber color and creamy head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, melanoidins, caramel, herbs like pellet, dry.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Too bitter and a little bit to rough, but it was nice to try. In any case, this is a nice alt.
(On tap) Clear mid brown with big head. Subtle aroma with vegetable hop notes. Medium bodied and well carbonated. Good bitterness over a sweet toffee and nuts. Very nice.

For me this is the best of its type. Dry, malt finish, You need to drink at least three, 0.25ml "becher" to develop the palate. Many find this "Ale" a little overpowering compared to the other Duesseldorf and Krefelder Alt beers. Draught is always superior to bottled or even a five litre tin barrel if you can get it?

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is caramel, floral, earthy hops, sweet, potpourri. Appearance is darker amber brown, light tan head, hazy. Taste is balanced, caramel, earthy hops, metallic, sweet malt, very crushable. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, soft, earthy hop and caramel aftertaste. Overall, this is very true to style.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. The fucking book. The pour is a darker ruby tinted brown color with a huge cream colored head that falls slowly leaving a pretty soapy lace. The aroma is much grainier than I was expecting. There is a sweet malt and an interesting chocolate happening that Im not overly fond of. The its dry and powdery. The flavor is sweet and metallic. There is a light malt and a little fruit present. Its just sweet malt and metallic lager yeast. There is a hint of dirty earthy hop. Damn. The mouth feel is thin and light with a bigger carbonation, but its still thin. The aftertaste is sweet and metallic malts. Its not awful, but its not the best.

#856Many thanks to pivnizub!Bottle. Clear red to brown body, medium off-white head. Pleasant aroma of malts, strawberries, rowanberries, currant, bread. Taste is moderately bitter, semi-dry. Strawberries, berries, honey, red currant, bread. Medium body and carbonation. Very good one.
Bottle thanks to Erzengel. Pours clear dark amber with small white head. Aroma: sauerkrauts with macrolager, hay. Taste: bitter, some dry hay, oak corn. Thin plus body. Dry. Bitter finish.
Dark amber liquid with minimal head. Aroma of hay. Taste of straw, medium+ bitter, light sour. Light body, long fin.

Trade with pivnizub, díky Guenthere! Bottle 0.5l. Almost clear, deep amber colored. AROMA- malty, bready, red berries, strawberries, carrot. FLAVOR- smooth, neutral to slightly dry, quite bitter, malty and bready, berries and strawberries. Medium bodied. Very good.

Chestnut brown with foam head. Nut, caramel, malt and some hops in the nose. Fresh and clean malty with a tiny aggressive touch and a calm but nice and present bitterness. Bitter dry and malty aftertaste.
Klares dunkles rotbraun mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, hopfig, etwas Karamell, Kekse, trocken, angenehm bitter.

Optisch und in der Nase etwas enttäuschend, zu klar und nur verhalten Aromen zu erschnuppern. Das ändern sich dann erstaunlich schnell mit dem extrem hopfenbitteren Trunk. Toll. Dezent säuerlich und schön würzig. 0,2/1,90 vom Hahn im UERIGE Düsseldorf.

(Tap) Es hat eine dunkle, kupferne bis braune Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist malzig, eher trocken, warm und etwas nach Keller. Der Geschmack ist fast heftig, trocken mit einer angenehmen bittere die sich über den ganzen Mundraum verteilt. Im Nachgeschmack ist die bittere kräuterig und prickelnd
Flasche 0,5l, kupferfarben, Aroma malzig mit grasiger Hopfennote, Geschmack gut balanciert zwischen altbiertypischer Malznote und Bitternote, angenehm bitter im Abgang
UPDATED: JUN 13, 2016 Clear amber body with a thin white head. Aroma is caramel. Taste is sweet and and medium bitter. Light bitter finish.

F: big, white, good retention.
C: deep coppery, clear.
A: malt, caramel, grassy/floral hoppy.
T: malt, caramel, hint of metallic, grassy more than average bitterness, medium body, good carbonation, on tap in Uerige Obergärige brewery in Düsseldorf.

Bottle from Qbrick. 
Deep matte brown with a thick beige head. A bitter roasty malt which pairs with bacon well. Good malt forward caramel with a sharp bitter character. Good.
Tap @ Uerige Obergärige Hausbrauerei, Düsseldorf. Pours a dark auburn brown with a good, beige head. Aroma is dark bread, grain. Taste is somewhat grassy and herbal, some malt, dark loaf of bread.

500 mml bottle tasted on the 18/05/2016. Copper color with a nice and dense white head. Aroma of caramel, intense malts, licorice and some wood. Taste is predominated by caramel and malts with some biscuits and licorice. Next one please!

Bottle. Beautiful chestnut color with tan head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, spicy, earthy hops. Taste is earthy-herbal, nutty, bready, malty, bitter caramel, toffee, slightly metallic, with a big herbal-bitter finish. Silky mouthfeel, full-bodied, fine-bubbled carbonation. An Altbier revelation.

330 bottle. Transparrent amber colour. Nice white head. Disappears quite quickly. Aroma is malty and caramelly. Bit flowery. First taste is bit caramelly and flowery too. Bitterness in the middle makes this very drinkable. Some maltiness and nice bitterness in the end. Very drinkable.

Tap at the brewery. Pours a pale copper colour with lasting firm white head. Aroma of malt, bread, banana and raisin. Moderate sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium body, sticky texture. Finish has a malty bready bitterness.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 From 0,5 L bottle. Dark red-brown, clear beer with an off-white, creamy head with tiny pores. Moderate malty aroma, roasted grains and caramel. Hops and yeast are nearly not recognizable in the aroma. Light to medium body with a good, crispy hoppyness. Very slightly sweet initial taste, light to medium bitterness, flavor is dominated by roasted malts which fits well to the hoppy bitteness making a very good combination. Medium to heavy bitter and quite long finish. Dry texture with medium carbonation. I like it pretty much.

Aroma: malt, caramel
Solid malty taste with notes of caramel and hops
Strong bitter aftertaste
02-Mar-2016-0,5L Flasche. Dunkelbraun, cremefarbener Schaum. Aroma Malzig, röstig. Antrunk bitter, röstig, malzig. Fein.

On tap @So Good (Rome). Pours deep amber with a medium white/beige head. Aroma of apple, grass, malt, biscuit. Flavour is medium sweet with a decent bitter end. Medium to light body, medium carbonation. Nice.

Citrus flavour
Slight malt smell
Very clear bitterness in the finish

Good Alt Bier.
Clear but fairly dark maple syrup colour with very little head. Aroma is caramel and chestnuts. Taste starts as little bit sweet but finishes bitter.
Cask @ the brewery. Clear amber with white head. Malt aroma. Sweet malt aroma, caramel, dry bitter herbal finish. The best alt I had in Dusseldorf

Enttäuschend. Viel Röstmalz, ein wenig Karamell und Brotkrume, aber ansonsten recht wenig.Schmeckt flach, recht eintönig.
Cremige Konsistenz.
Schade

Old school alt. Poured with a big frothy head that soon settled. Aroma is malt, toffee, bit of roast. Flavor is bitter and dry with only the barest hint of sweet in the finish. Perfect amount of carbonation, otherwise rather light in body. Super easy drinking;

A dark golden brown that is pleasant in the eye. Subtle malty aroma. Moderatly thin mouthfeel. Taste starts with malt, caramel and nuts. It transfers to a bitter hoppy finish that stays with you for some time. Favorite Altbier.
Pours dark brown with medium head. Aroma: caramel, malt. Taste: again caramel, a bit malty, nutty, with an interesting slightly estery finish (from the yeast?). Classic alt.

Light /medium aroma with slightly sour notes of dark berries, grains and toffee.
Very deep golden color with small thick white head. Clear liquid. Medium taste bit bitter malts, nuts, hops and some caramel. balanced. Medium taste spectrum and medium/long hoppy malty aftertaste. Medium/light body with low /med carbonation. Overall high quality school book like alt though nothing special.
Vom Fass im Brauhaus.Schönes klares Dunkelbraun. dezenter Malzduft. Kräftigmalzig und bitter im Geschmack. Der Klassiker aus Düsseldorf.Fürmich bisher das beste Altbier.Extrem süffig!
Schöne braune Farbe, recht wenig Schaum, Geruch malzig, im Antrunk leicht süßlich dann schön würzig leicht herb, sehr sehr süffig, im brauhaus in Düsseldorf getrunken einer der besten alt überhaupt

Saaz like aroma with toast background. Harsh bitterness much like Schumacher original with resiny flavor. Flavor is more of a light malt with toast and caramel tones. Not Malty rich. Dry hoppy finish.

Bottle, thanks Erzengel, medium long lasting bubbly head, clear very dark red color, aroma of caramel, bread and vanila, flavor of caramel and bread with roasty hints and and empathic herbal bitterness and a light pleasant bitterness. Good and satisfying.

Cask at Zum Uerige in Dusseldorf  
Clear dark amber with a medium sized beige head, good lacing. Aroma of toasted malts and caramel. Taste of caramel, dark fruit with a mild smokiness in finish  
Nice

Botella, Thanks @Lowenbrau. 23/07/2015 Bottled: 22/06/2015
Color ambar, aromas caramelo, malta, sabor dulce

500ml bottle. 23-07-2015.
Bottled: 22-06-2015.
Courtesy of MichaelAwesome. Thanks a lot!.
In short: roasty light beer.
Pours little hazy copper with nice off white head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. roasty, caramel, liquorice, herbal nose. Light body, average carbonation, little crispy texture. Taste is moderate bitter, some caramel and roasty notes, some biscuit, liquorice. Roasty bitter finish. Very enjoyable.
From tap. Almost clear dark amber reddish color with off white head. Malty aroma, grainy, caramel, light hoppy, light fruity. Sweet and light bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

500 ml bottle. Bottled on 12/Jun. At the Kahdet Kasvot, Tampere, Finland. 
Clear copper color with a big foamy light tan head.
Sweet malt, mild metal and mild fruity hops in the aroma. 
The flavor is hops, mild bitterness and malt. Some mild metallic notes there too. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 From the Bottle. Pours amber with thick white head. High carbonation. Aroma is rosted malt and a milky thing Kind of old Milk but in a pleasent way. Some grassy hops is also noticeable. Taste is bitter with a typical earthy taste of altbier. Hops and grass. Some remaining sweetness. Long lasting bitter finish. Classic must have drunk altbier!

Draft 0.25l at Zum Uerige Dusseldorf Germany. Pour it clear dark amber color with medium white head.On the nose caramel.Taste start with watery, then bitter, sweet caramel and finishes with rusty note.Perfect balanced.Very good.
Pours amber/caramel with a white head. Aroma is lager malts and caramel. Taste is caramel, slightly fruity, touch of berry and slightly earthy

Well, I suppose if I wrote comments about Alt-Bier from Duesseldorf, they wouldnt be neutral. I just love the Alt-Bier from Duesseldorf. They are simply next to none. So, I judge all the beers from "Altstadt Duesseldorf" equally.
Pours orange to brown with a beige head, aroma of caramel, toasted bread, flavor is bitter with caramel, toasted bread, toffee, medium bodied.

500ml flip top bottle at home from trade with Erzengel, many thanks. . dark amber / redish clear color. medium big off-white head. smells fruity, plums and cherries, acidic, honey. medium body, soft carbonation, slick moutfeel. tastes malty sweet, light honey, some citric notes, some fruity notes, acidic, some dark fruits. finishes light citric bitter and with some bread notes. decent one.

Clear red-brown colour, white persistent head. 
Malty, dried dates, Pumpernickel, fruity. 
Dry, medium bitterness, a rather leight body, soft carbonation and a very fine bitterness.
0.2l draft at the brewery pub and restaurant in Dusseldorf Altstadt, Excellent.

Pięknie wygląda, klarowny ciemny bursztyn, stosunkowo gęsta duża piana, opadła do kilku milimetrów z ładnym osadzaniem. W aromacie słodowo, chlebowo, może odrobina tradycyjnych chmieli. W smaku podobnie, pełne, zbalansowane, z umiarkowaną goryczką. Solidny alt z dusseldorfu.

Bottle, 330ml. Pours medium-dark reddish brown, head is short and cream colored. Aroma is strong and pleasant: sweet ripe fruit, malt, and some bready notes. Mouth feel is slightly creamy with quite a thin body and gentle carbonation. Tastes very dry, just the slightest sweetness at finish. Slight hoppy bitterness. Flavors are gentle, with some fruity hop, medium roasted not sweet malt, slight yeasty-alcoholic notes. Flavors are very balanced but somewhat flat, they are very gentle, quite boring even. This is a beer to drink slowly over a good launch.

Pours a clear dark copper with a 1" head of foam. 

Smell is malty, earthy hops, nutty. 

The taste surpasses the pleasant smell. A kind of earthy and spicy hop thing going on with a nice nutty sweet ish malt presence. Smooth and tasty with a nice mouthfeel and I reckon I am drinking a fine Alt indeed.
Schöne goldbraune klare Farbe. Sehr angenehmer Geruch: Malz, leicht geröstet. Im Mund zeigt sich eine unerwartete Bitterkeit, die gut mit dem Röstmalz harmonisiert. Insgesamt ein gutes Bier!

Easy to drink and nice beer all around. Not quite the best as some of ueriges other entries but still very nice. Pours cloudy brown with good head and lacing. Medium bitter finish with lots of sharp grain. Bottle.
I had this beer at Uerige in Dusseldorf. Typical Dusseldorf style alt beer. Nice creamy head with good retention. Fruity and nicely balanced aroma. Hop kicks in at the end. Nice session beer.
Honestly not the best to end on, but I aint running this shit, mother fuckers. On top of that, I had to drink the Schenkerla Rauchbier Märzen right before.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a big off-white head. Aroma of caramel, toasted malt and earthy hops. Sweetish malty flavors with fruity and herbal notes, pleasant hoppy bitterness, long finish. Medium bodied,slightly dry mouthfeel. Decent.

Bottle from McTapps, many thanks. Aroma malty, caramel, yeasty. Clear brown colour. Taste is same as aroma, basementy yeasty, light caramelly yeastiness. Rather high bitterness, minor hoppy notes. OK for the style.
Bottle at home. Pours deep copper color, white head. Aroma is malty, grainy. Taste starts medium sweet, malty, than hoppy kick comes. Bitter hoppy finish.

Bottle 330ml. Clear copper with medium beige head. Malty aroma, ripe fruits (plum, pear), notes of caramel and a bit spicy. There is a moderate sweet maltiness in the flavor, quite spicy with notes of black pepper, notes of caramel, moderate bitterness and long lasting citrus sourness. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied. Very drinkable.

Attractive swing top bottle. Found this at a European restaurant and it went well with the food. It was not to impressive on its own, however. Pretty close to an amber in style, with some acidity and smoky malt.

Bottle received in the Euroswap. Thank you Erzengel! Pours clear deep amber with a frothy beige head that leaves some spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty, tiny fruity and earthy with dark bread, crisp bread, hay, moist soil, minerals, plums, lemon peal and hints of banana. Taste is tiny sweet, slightly bitter, malty and earthy with dark bread, caramel, hay, moist soil, minerals, red apples and lemon peal. Mouthfeel is soft, round, slightly astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is bitter with dark bread, hay, moist soil, minerals and lemon peal. Slight banana and Apple esters Im not a huge fan off but the dark malts blend nicely with the earthy hops providing a solid enough backbone to make this a pleasant experience.
Sweet aroma and taste. Dried fruits. Certain depth in the flavour and feeling. Good overall

Sample @ company beer tasting on 16-01-2015 fom memory.
Easy, dark, roasty, not too exciting but good one.

Piwko głęboko czerwone, klarowne, piana obfita, trwała, drobnopęcherzykowa. Aromat przede wszystkim słodowy, czuć słód karmelowy, coś tam wychodzi też z drożdży, jest lekko chlebowo. W smaku lekko wodniste, goryczkowe, palone, zmierza w stronę koźlaka. Wysycenie słabe, goryczka zalegająca, na języku szerokie.
Malty bread aroma with weak yeast notes. Taste is dominated by continental hop making this beer very close to a good pilsner a bit. Aftertaste is awesome - herbs, grass, very elegant.

Uerige Alt is the very definition of German Altbier. Dark ruby color, dense white foam with good retention, malty, complex ale aroma. Clean, intense bitterness with a roasty malt backbone. Other German Altbiers pale (literally) in comparison to Uerige. It is a wonder to me how they manage to export any of their product given their extremely limited production capacity and their popularity in and around Düsseldorf. This is a first cousin to the English IPA´s, but it is has a dry, clean finish, not fruity or musty like the English beers. Microbrewers take note: this is the target to shoot for. no over the top floral hops, no explosion of fruity esters, no scratchy astringency. I challenge all of you to produce anything even remotely resembling Uerige Alt!

One of Germanys few and richest top-fermenting beers, truly a German ale plenty of character and reminscent of a more complex UK bitter/ESB/IPA. Generous earthy, leafy (in part UK, e.g. Fuggle/East Kent Golding?) hops in perfect harmony with a layered biscuit caramalt base. Rich, but not overly filling like a Weizen, easy drinking but unfortunately still too hard to come by outside of NRW/even greater Düsseldorf./From tap @source, 02/2014: smooth and creamy, with extra dry wooden notes, perfectly balanced and superior in mat-hop balance to the Sticke maltbombs.

Draft @ Uerige. Deep amber with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, nuts, fruity and herbs. Flavor is bread, caramel, firm bitterness and light fruity yeast. Medium body with a smooth feel. Great Alt fresh from the source, smooth, malty and very drinkable.

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a clear chesnut brown with a bubbly white head. The aroma is rich malty fruit. The flavour is very complex. Its medium to weak bitter with some resin, raisins and malt with a watery slightly liqourice palate.

Bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Pours clear brown with a bubbly off white head. Aroma of toffee, raisins, some nuts, light pine, a little soap, flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Systembolaget.

Hazy brown with a large large, tan head. Aroma and taste of malt, herbs, yeast, grass and spices. Nicely drinkable with a dry and bitter finish. A nice Altbier.

Bottle at rabbit club. My buddy mike is from Germany and used to live near this brewery so I figured continue my European drinking night with 5th different country. Pours muddy orange with sweet nose. Tastes lightly sweet, raisins, earth, malt, spices, vanilla, and leaves. I was quite drunk by this point and my notes were tough to decipher luckily I left after this one.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2014 Bottle 0.5l. Dark copper beer with a not very firm head. Taste is quite bitter but full of flavour. More complex and powerful than the rest of Düsseldorfs home breweries. Still my favourite Alt.

(tap) Dark copper to chestnut coloured, clear, with a very long-lasting and creamy beige head. Intense toasted flavours, very nutty, loads of almost piney hops, freshly-cut wood, grassy. The smell is wonderful! Medium to strongly bitter taste, long finish/aftertaste. Overall: magic!

Flaska från SB. Bärnstensfärgad, klar med smutsvitt bestående skum som till sist bildar ett tätt lock. Fin örtig och blommig humledoft med brödiga maltaromer i bakgrunden. Torr och stram för stilen och samtidigt lite gräddig och krämig i munnen. Klockren örtig beska som är smakrik, rund och distinkt på samma gång. Blomsteräng, örter, gräs, nybakt bröd. Riktigt, riktigt gott.

Bottle.
Pours muddy brown with a big head.
Spicy, yeasty aroma, almost belgian.
Big bodied, sweet fudge, spicy. Scotsch ale like. Lots of flavour for the low abv.

Aroma: Smelling of bread, sour fruits, old cheese and yeast.Appearance: A clouded brown colored beer. A tan head with good lacing and some curtains.Taste: Tasting of brown bread, bitter green grapes, almond and apple peel.Palate: Medium carbonation, small bubbles, a coarse texture. A medium body with a long dry finish.Overall: A bit rough. Should maybe sit a few months.Note: Bottle 330 ml. Reviewed 2013-06-12.
Bottle. Dark, cloudy amber with a huge, creamy head. malty with fruity tones. Malt, caramel, fruit and hops. Medium body with a nice, bitter sweet finish.

20cl glass from keg at the brewpub. 
Thick creamy white head.   Clear amber pour.   Nice refreshing bitterness.

Bottle. Pours a lovely murky orange colo with a creamy off white head. Somewhat spicy (in a light cardamum kind of way) aroma with notes of cream and dark bread. Deep, complex, bitter taste. Bready with a herbal pilslike bitterness and some fruity sweetness. Also some marzipan and vegtables. Fresh and yet somewhat dry in the finish. Wonderful balance!
Bottled. Pours cloudy brown with a small light brown head. Smells sweet bread malty. Tastes clear bitter, abit bread malty, good balance.

A - Thick 2.5 finger tan head on top of a hazel brown. The foam creates rocky mounds and retains well.

S - Toasted bready malt, tangy doughy yeasty, faint caramel.

T - Lots of bread crust, it tastes exactly like toasted bread crust. Gets roasty in the middle with caramel swirling around. A firm grassy hop bitterness brings in the finish.

M - Medium to full body with ample carbonation, peppery dry finish.

This was straightforward that would be great on a fall evening. Lots of bread with caramel and peppery hops to balance it out. If your interested in this style you should pick this one up.

Serving type: bottle

05-18-2012
Bottled:Pours hazy brown with a thick head. Malt and yeast aroma, some dark fruit. Malt and yeast flavour, also some metal and licorice. Long, grassy bitterness.

Bottle pour. Pours a hazy, lighter colored amber with a small, beige head of foam. Aroma is a little grainy and mildly nutty. Taste is soft malt with a touch of bitter finish. Kind of middle of the road.
Bottle - Dark amber in colour. Caramel, nuts and dried fruit in the aroma. Tangy, fruity and malty taste with notes of raisins, sultanas and walnuts.
la primera alt que tome. 11am. me encanto. muy buen aroma, mezcla de lupulo y caramelo. mucho amargor en sabor. fresca.

Dark brown slight orange with big frothy head.  Aroma of medicinal grass, raisins spicy flowers/soap.  Tastes like hoisin sauce, (browned sugar and acidity), leather.  Robust bitterness herbal hops that melds well with roast flavors and alcohol.  Not sweet.   Dry but not too dry on the palate.  Would be excellent with a steak.

Lekkere romige schuimkraag. Mooi donkerrood helder bier. Hoppig en overwegend caramel smakend bier. Zachte afdronk.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had it on tap at Zum Uerige. I had very high expectations for this beer but reality was not that good :( Slight caramel in taste, moderate bitterness in the end - thats all that I can say. But place is great.

Tap at Sum Uerige Dusseldorf, served by some grumpy twat, 28/04/13.
Dark chestnut brown with a good sized beige head.
Nose is dark malt, mineral notes, toffee, light spice.
Taste comprises treacle toffee, cheescake base, brown sugars.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation.
Decent alt.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Aroma: roasted sweet malt, grain, notes of milk chocolate, cocoa, and banana. As it warms some light smoke and grassy hop shows through.
Flavor: like the nose but the grassy bitter hop quickly attacks and grassy bitterness dominates the finish.
Comment: the hops have not integrated with the malt; clearly very young (2/2013 made on date and a 2/2014 drink by date). Active carbonation and very firm bitterness. The hops come across as an almost amateur home brew. I would wait for at least 6 months before trying again. This bottle was reefered so its not a problem with storage conditions.
Ruby, tall persistent white head. Malty aroma. Some cherry and caramel taste. Metallic

Draught.
Pours a clear copper with a white head.
Malty aroma, caramel, hops, yeast, chocolate.
Dry, medium body, mid to high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty, astringent taste, caramel, hops, yeast, slightly metallic (in a positive way), very clean. Really nice. (2013-03-24)

Bottle (bottled a week ago!). Brown clear. Brown malty, good nutty nose with some greeny hoppiness. Body is quite smooth. Bitter, with some hoppy flavours, but mostly rich, a bit bready, brown/butty maltiness. Clean, refreshing. Really nice and fresh.

Bottle from M&D.  Probably my first altbier and it remains a style I just dont understand (probably because i am a stupid American).   Slightly toasty, some caramel, dark fruits.  Roasty, fruity, malt driven beer.

Pours slightly cloudy brown with a huge , pillowy, tan head.
Aroma is malt, light caramel, dust, florals.
Taste is slightly woody/earthy.
Sweet, changing slowly to a long, dry, pleasant bitter.
Very nice.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2015 500ml fliptop bottle (One Pint Pub, Helsinki)
Nice dry malty aroma. Looks brilliant - dep red, huge frothy head. Quite weird in the mouth, lots of wood, but strange wineyness, Touch of ginger in the aroma. Crisp palete. Quite active carbonation. Lots of dry earthy hops, maybe soapy, but not in a bad way. Actually quite bitter and sharp, acidic with hop resins. Love the ginger aroma! Prefer the previous bready alt but this is great to.
Rerate: Cask (Uerige, Dusseldorf) (6:4:6:3:12=3.1) 
Deep red, tight head. Dry nutty aroma, but something almost cheesy too. Bready, nutty woody and bitter. Tons of fruity esters, but again something is not quite right here. Not quite solventy, but hinting that way. Some jamminess too. Not a great beer, but Ive just seen the revolution of the barrel on the bar, and its put a real smile on my face.
Light grain aroma with light German floral hops. Clear dark orange color with a large white head. Light sweet beginning with a moderate bitter finish.

0,5 l swing top bottle    BB 17. Apr 13 
bread, cereal, coffee, toast, roasty, herbs, spruce, earthy, brown, clear, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter and long finish,
Bottle. From notes, tasting session at Qbrick. Very mild initial, but pleasant bitter finish. As it should be.

500ml bottle at some small restaurant in Munich. Pours a clear, deep copper-amber colored body with a finger-width, frothy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is lightly sweetened pale malts with just a touch of caramel and toast. A bit of a grainy, earthy bitterness and some fruits as well. Flavor is similar. Well bittered throughout with some graininess and a nice, smooth, clean, lightly sweetened malt backing. Touches of caramel, a nice fruitiness, and hints of toast. Finishes dry and bitter before leaving a lengthy aftertaste. Medium-light body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a really awesome altbier. Dry and bitter, but well balanced and very easy drinking.

Rich, malty nose with some raisin and some honey.  Pours a deep amber with a strong head.  Flavour is well-rounded with initial front of tongue honey sweetness giving way to a long, bitter finish.  Very tasty and very moreish.

large frothy white head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. hazy average-density dark orangeish-amber body. aroma: honey, milk chocolate, caramel, moderate malty. if: moderate sweet light bitter. ff: light sweet moderate bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish.mescla um interessante dulçor maltado com amargor lupulado, com este ultimo sobrepujando o primeiro no aftestaste, cerveja bem saborosa, de boa drinkability, bem feita. Keg 5 liters. Shared with Rex Talionis. Pours really nice copper color with a big foamy head. First sips good roasted feel to it. Roasted nuts. Altbier is an slow opening beer like wine the first sips arent the best but after you get abit used to it the taste will start to open up. With Amon Amarth playing in the background seems like this taste of the great beer they call Altbier started to taste even better. The great taste of Altbier does not change even if you drink much of it, it pretty much stays the same good constant all through the whole experience of the time while consuming it.  Its like the Gods themselves descended down just to bring/brew us the perfect beer. Truly ambrosia of the Gods. First time i tasted Altbier was in Dûsseldorf which was a great city with nice people and awesome beer. Altbier now tastes as epic as it did in Dusseldorf. If i would have to choose only one beer to drink from now on to eternity Altbier would surely be it. In a word EXCELLENT. Prost för Gudarna!

Darkish color...
Medium body.
Aromas of caramel and malt.
Malty taste with a dry bitter long aftertaste.
Very nice beer, for its kind.

#5
Handwerklich gebrautes Alt mit stoutähnlichen Röstaromen im Abgang. Zweifelsohne ein Alt mit Ecken und Kanten, aber wahrlich ein Charakter. Fazit: Wer staubtrockene Altbiere mag, wird das Uerige vergöttern!
Nur Diebelstrinker sollten darum einen großen Bogen machen...
Aroma is malts and dark fruit.  The flavor is malts, dark fruit, a small hint of rum and a mostly smooth finish.

On tap at Zum Uerige in Dusseldorf in the fall of 2008. A clear, copper-brown color with little head. Malts, caramel, nuts, spice in the aroma, and the taste was great. Very smooth. Maybe it was also the experience of this location (which was great), but this was my favorite beer from this trip. Still the best Alt beer I have tried.
Bottled. Brown color with a nice beige head. Aroma is sweet caramel and dark fruits. Bitter flavor with hints of malt, bread and toffee. Mouthfeel is long and bitter..

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2015 Draught at the brewpub: Well, it still is the most caramelly out of the four great Dusseldorf altbiers. It still has an excellent, soft mouthfeel. It still is nutty. But drunk on the 12.11.2015, poured from a wooden barrel, it was characterised by an overload of buttery diacetyl and fruit esters. And with that great malting being pushed into the background by strawberry butter, it was a disheartening experience.

First rating: Bottle. Nice brown colour but the head is disappointingly small and short. And that is luckily the end of disappointments with this beer. Dark malts coupled with basement aromas in the nose. Caramelly, toasted and nutty, with dried fruit (dates perhaps?) and a very shy roasted note. Refreshing though rather medium bodied. Quite a strong hoppy bitterness with a roasted note. Malty, caramelly flavour with dried fruit. Awesome!

Half finger of tan head. Copper, almost brown, colored body.
Smell is barnyardish, hay, caramel and tinge of lemon.
Taste is bitter/sweet at first, sweet caramel in the middle, long dry bitter finish. A little sourness throughout. 
Medium body, low carbonation. Slightly sticky texture. 
Tasty and a good altbier.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2016 Draught at the brewpub. Clear deep amber to copper, medium off-white head. Nutty, earthy, bisquity, with floral hops. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with a firm lingering bitterness.

Amber pour with a small tan head. An almost woody aroma to this. A lot of toasted malt, bread, and toffee with a hint of grape fruitiness. The flavor is fairly straightforward, but does have some of the same wood notes. Plenty of caramel, toffee, bread, and toasted malt flavors. Nothing much in the way of hops, but a light bitterness and some grape fruit notes.

Clear copper colour, off-white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, light nutty, slight spicy hop. Sweet malty flavour with a pronounced bitter note. Light roasted notes. Medium body, finish caramel, light sweet, bitter hops with a light lingering roastiness.
Great beer, good atmosphere.
(Draught @ Zum Uerige)

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2013 Fresh on tap at the brewpub. After Ive rated the beer in a bottled version before -and just didnt like it-, I was ready for another test with the fresh draught beer. It has got a hazy amber/brown colour with steady head and medium to crisp body. Nose of hops and nuts. Taste of medium bitter hops, grass, nuts, green fruits, citrus and toast. Floral hints with a quite bitter finish. Little bit too metallic for me and not that quaffable, but definately a very solide and refreshing Alt.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2013 Hatte ich der Flaschenabfuellung damals wirklich nur laecherliche 1,5 Punkte gegeben ! Heute aber, im Uerige zu Duesseldorf, da wurde gepunktet. Mit Malz, mit Rosineneraomen, sicherlich mit Atmosphaere. Und mit einer seltsamen Bitterkeit zum Ende hin. Gutes, aber nicht herausragendes Alt, das eine 1,5 aber nicht verdient hat und hatte.

Sweet Munich malt brew with just enough bitterness to balance the malt, but I wouldnt call it a bitter beer.  Smooth.  Easy to drink, but not particularly complex or interesting, especially at $5 per 11oz.
Very robust flavor. A great find if you get ahold of it. Very authentic down to the label being auf Deautsch.
Pours quite dark for an Alt. Sweet malty aroma, flavour is more of the same with some caramel. Dry bitter lingering finish.
Coppery/toffee colored pour. Big light tan head with plenty of lacing. Nice malty aroma. Bitter up front with a dry sweet malt flavor following. Finishes crisp and clean with a nice bitterness.

Tap @ Zum Uerige, Düsseldorf. Clear dark amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and nutty. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270712
Medium dark, clear bottle and creamy tan head. Malty base, nutty, some spices. Light roasted taste at first, a dry mouth feel from the middle onwards. Fragrant and drinkable. Nomnom.
Hazy amber pour with some sediment.  Funky cheese aroma.  Taste is pretty mild.  Some sugar and toffee.  Mouth is a little astringent.  Overall this is a very light beer for the color.

.375L bottle in a stem glass.  Pours brownish amber with a fluffy, light beige head.  Aroma of caramel and nutty malts, a decent amount of hops for a German beer, and some dough.  Flavor the same.  Average to smooth texture.  A good beer for the style.

Notes of rich caramel malt with a hint of light African coffee and toffee.  Reminds me of a forest in late fall after all the leaves have fallen but before the first snow.  Theres that aroma of slightly decayed leaves and woodsiness.  Pours a slightly cloudy red clay color with hints of yellow and brown.  The head is a tarnished white which dissipates quickly.  Smooth and refreshing with a tinge of bitterness.  Predominantly sweet but not cloyingingly so.  It is light on the tongue and smooth off the palate.

From a bottle pours a nice light reddish-amber with a decent head. Distinct aroma with hints of earthiness. Aroma is my least favorite aspect. The taste is really smooth and nice with hints of vanilla and toffee. A slight hint of smokiness at the finish really is the highlight of this one.
Pours a dark amber with a small head. Has a light aroma. Citrus flavors with a bitterness like chewing on grapefruit skin.

On tap at Zum Uerige
Dark golden color
Medium body and complexity- on the light side
Aa little sour, but served very fresh and good
Very enjoyable

500ml bottle. Clear amber, deep red glowing, with medium frothy off-white head. Nuttily malt and bitter hop aroma. Fresh, refreshing and pure bitter taste, not overdone, not too cautious. Excellent Altbier.

This was just plain terrible, the worst beer Ive ever tasted. Perhaps it has to do with my lack of experience with altbeer but I could not finish my glass filled with this brownish stuff which aroma Id compare to that of mud and sand. Very bitter too.

A reddish amber alt with a thin big bubbled off white head. In aroma, smooth vinous malt with raisins, light soy, interesting. In mouth, a sweet maderized malt with light vinous notes, a bit thin and dead, some corky notes.

50cl fliptop from Germany, with 15th anniversary label. Dark brown, white head, woody malt, burnt sultanas and a faint hint of citrus on the nose. Plenty of herby, oaky bitterness on the palate, plus touches of over-baked fruitcake and pepper. Alt is one of the old ale styles of Germany, so its no surprise that this good example reminds me of some English bitters.
Nice logical step from my light german beer. Good malt that wasnt too thick. Hops were very subtle but added good flavors. Alcohol was a bit low.
Bottle - very big thick head, murky medium brown color, woody malt aroma, mildly bitter malt flavor
ambrata buona schiuma piuttosto persistente naso leggermente tostato nocciola lieve  erbaceo secca amara

UPDATED: APR 6, 2012 hazy amber with a dense beige head. medium bodied with high carbonation and sharp minerality.

aroma: sweet bready malt, herbal hops, and some sour minerality.

taste: pretzely malt, dry minerality, herbal hops, and some fruity yeast esters. astringent roasted malt notes emerge as it warms.

this seems to be to pilsner what dunkel is to helles, like an amber pils.

11.2 oz swing-top bottle. Pours a dark copper color with a good head and nice lacing. Mild aroma of roasted malt and some caramel. A bit of fruit and hint of grain. Aroma blossoms as it warms. Flavor of roasted malt, bit of caramel sweetness, hint of spice and chocolate. A nice subtle bitterness and a dry finish. Fairly medium body, smooth and creamy. Very well balanced. A very easy drinking beer. A great example of the style. Well worth checking this one out.
Outstanding for the style. Caramel tones,  roasted,  lightly hopped.wonderful example of this style.. ..probably the best.

Bottle at Kernel with Nate & Toby. It pours dark amber/brown, with a thick beige head. The nose is nail varnish remover, sweet fruit, caramel and bubblegum. The taste is nail varnish remover, metal, dark fruit, cardboard, wood, caramel, roasted malt and bubblegum, with a long dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. So-so.

Cloudy metallic brown with touch of orange and medium-large tan head.  Aroma kind of muted, somewhat stale malts and faint caramel.  Smooth, medium-light body.  Flavor is rye bread malty, bitter hoppy finish, surprisingly crisp and easy to gulp down.  I feel like maybe the bottle I got was not the best, maybe better fresher, will reassess if appropriate.
Aroma of stale cheese. Odd stale flavour, but it is an altbier, so that figures, I suppose.

When it comes to alt there are few better.  Pours a dark garnet with a frothy off white head and good lacing.  Aroma is malt that is so rich its like a dirty sock.  Taste has a full mouthfeel of malt, slight cinnamon and an aftertaste of a small hop bitterness.  Great beer.

Caramel and roasty nose. Pours dark brown from bottle, opaque with light brown, frothy head.  Mildly sweet up front with moderate effervescence, with medium bitter finish.  My first altbier. It tastes like a strong ale and a pilsner had a baby.

On tap at the brewery.  First beer of the day.  Clear, copper body.  Abundant, frothy, meringue-like head is off-white and hangs around forever.  Very clingy  and paints on the lace.  Lightly spicy hop aroma with some toasty, rich malt underneath.  Munich malt flavors - toasty and some biscuit.  Mild, floral hop flavor.  Very light estery fruitiness comes through after a few swigs.  Balance is definitely on the bitter side...similar to an APA as far as BU:GU.  Firm bitterness with a pleasant sweetness peaking through.  Bitterness hangs around through the finish.  Light carbonation keeps the beer easy drinking.  Overall and excellent beer that I could drink all day long!  Perfect complement to a Mettbrötchen!

33 cl bottle, rated on 19.10.2010
Orange-brown colour. Aroma has fruits, butter and malt. Flavour has sourish malt and hints of fruits and toffee. Feels a lot like an English bitter.

330ml Bottle:  Got in trade from phaleslu; THANKS Peter!  Aroma of malt, Earth, yeast, baking bread, and some leaves.  Poured brown in color with small to medium-sized, creamy, dense, off-white/tan head that diminished a bit but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of small particles throughout.  Very good lacing.  Flavor is lightly sweet and light to medium bitter.  Tastes of malt, Earth, slight hops, and leafs.  Medium body.  Watery, then dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, Earth finish is lightly sweet, medium bitter, and dry.
Bottle. Many thanks to pivnizub. Cola like brown color with huge beige head. Aroma of  caramel, prunes, clove. Strong bitter taste, with hints of malt, bread and caramel. Long bitter finish. Nice.

bardzo dobry alt, chyba ma trochę więcej goryczki niż Fuchschen Alt i dlatego jak na mój gust oceniam je troszeczkę niżej, nie zmenia to jednak faktu że piwo godne polecenia, z zamknięciem top-flip ma 2 miesiące ważności

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2012 full body, creamy, thick feel, medium bitterness, medium sourness, brown, minimal head, caramel. The bitter aftertaste just detracts a little from the overall score for me but a lovely beer nonetheless.
---
Re-rating this after a trip to the brewery in Düsseldorf. Its really excellent on draft and the bitterness after a few beers is very pleasant.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2013 On tap at Holy Grale. Aroma of bread, light nuts, light herbal hops and a little apple. Appearance is murky brown with foamy tan head. Flavor is bready up front; but overall is quite dry and herbal. The finish is molto secco. Palate is medium, sticky and very soft. A rugged, working class bier, but not particularly an enjoyable one. Still, this has a very authentic feel.

Very dark pour - like a cola brown. Big foam head - quite dense. Nose is very malty with a bit of honey, wheat and a floral suggestion underpinning it. Very full bodied for the ABV. Nut, caramel and a hint of chocolate with a solid bitterness to finish. Very good beer and one that you could sit on. Would definitely suit winter/cooler periods due to the body. This is what good beer is all about.

This is a very decent beer. It pours a light chocolate brown with no head at all. It smells sour almost like a Rodenbach. With it hits your palate it tastes like a sour ale at then immediately switches to notes of chocolate with a finish thats reminiscent of maple syrup. Very good, willl drink again..

Insgesamt sehr hopfenbetontes Alt in einer rustikalen Flasche. 
Malziger Geruch mit leichten Kaffeenoten im Hintergrund. Auf der Zunge halten sich Malz und Hopfenbittere schön die Waage. 
Ein ausdruckstarkes Alt. Kräftiger Körper.Test vom 7.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

On tap at ChurchKey. Served in a mini snifter.

Pour is a caramel-colored liquid that is mostly clear. Thin off-white head and a bit of lacing. Nose brings a good amount of light bread and earthy hops. Nothing too complex; perhaps a bit of very light fruit. Flavor is similarly restrained with some bread and then not too much else. However, the hops coke through in the finish for a good bitterness. Light body and good carbonation. Good, but nowhere near the Sticke or, especially, the Doppelsticke.

330 ml swing-top bottle with a cool shape from The Royale. Bottled 1/11. Pours a hazy brownish-amber color with an inch-thick, rocky off-white head. Aroma of big toasty malts, nuts, earth, wheat, and sweet dough. Flavor of rich, sweet bread and dough, wheat, nuts, and earth. Medium-bodied, with a malty mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Really nice traditional but big German altbier.

This is my first altbier. Though not my usual thing, I would definitely drink this if it was around. Tickly on the tongue! While not overwhelming, it definitely had enough going on in every department.

Deep copper brown colour. Aroma is fairly malty for a Altbier. Taste successfully combines fruity and malty elements to a refreshing body, which is characteristic of the best altbier brews. There are plenty of caramel flavours in the aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2012 Bottle 50 cl. Deep red/amber, clear with a large offwhite frothy head. Fruites and sweet malts dominates this beer. Nice and sweet taset with a light bitter end. GOod.  Dusseldorf 22.06.2011

Die schlichte Flasche wirkt edel, die Krone präsentiert sich haltbar. Auch wenn ein malziges Aroma klar zu erkennen ist steht bei diesem Alt ein herb-bitteres Aroma im Vordergrund. Das vollmundige Alt hat im Agang außer dem stabilen udn lang anhaltenden bitter-malzigen Aroma noch eine gewisse Kernigkeit zu bieten, was das Bier aber nicht unbedingt süffiger macht. Man sitzt an einem Glas Uerige wohl deutlich länger als bei vielen anderen Altbieren, was aber nichts negatives ist.

Good head and nice amber cloudy body. Not sure if this was a bad bottle or not, but the taste is very sour. Very light on the palate and a bit watery.

Serving: 330 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors.  It pours a ruddy brown with a small, white head.  The nose has notes of noble hops, bread, and a slight nutty note. Pours a clear, dark amber - lots of suspended particles - with a whopper of a thick, off white head that becomes a rocky foamberg in my glass. Awesome lacing. Mild caramel nose, grassy.
